speaker: Crypt Steps
lines: Stone sweats in beaded lines; each bead holds a shivering candle flame inside.
The steps count you—one, two, three—then lose interest and start over.
Names carved into the rail wear thin where rings worried them for decades.
A breeze climbs from below that smells of pepper and old paper.
Your lantern's light folds against a corner and refuses to go any farther.
The deeper you go, the more the silence sounds like rehearsal.
You hear the faintest chime: metal touching bone, politely.
The family vault waits with a door that knows how to close well.

choices.text: Veer into the narrow stairs toward the ossuary.
Go back while the count is still in your favor.
